25#define TRACE(...) \
26 do { \
27 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) PrintF(__VA_ARGS__); \
28 } while (false)
29
30Scheduler::Scheduler(Zone* zone, Graph* graph, Schedule* schedule, Flags flags,
31 size_t node_count_hint, TickCounter* tick_counter,
32 const ProfileDataFromFile* profile_data)
33 : zone_(zone),
34 graph_(graph),
35 schedule_(schedule),
36 flags_(flags),
37 scheduled_nodes_(zone),
38 schedule_root_nodes_(zone),
39 schedule_queue_(zone),
40 node_data_(zone),
41 tick_counter_(tick_counter),
42 profile_data_(profile_data),
43 common_dominator_cache_(zone) {
44 node_data_.reserve(node_count_hint);
45 node_data_.resize(graph->NodeCount(), DefaultSchedulerData());
46}
47
48Schedule* Scheduler::ComputeSchedule(Zone* zone, Graph* graph, Flags flags,
49 TickCounter* tick_counter,
50 const ProfileDataFromFile* profile_data) {
51 Zone* schedule_zone =
52 (flags & Scheduler::kTempSchedule) ? zone : graph->zone();
53
54 // Reserve 10% more space for nodes if node splitting is enabled to try to
55 // avoid resizing the vector since that would triple its zone memory usage.
56 float node_hint_multiplier = (flags & Scheduler::kSplitNodes) ? 1.1 : 1;
57 size_t node_count_hint = node_hint_multiplier * graph->NodeCount();
58
59 Schedule* schedule =
60 schedule_zone->New<Schedule>(schedule_zone, node_count_hint);
61 Scheduler scheduler(zone, graph, schedule, flags, node_count_hint,
62 tick_counter, profile_data);
63
64 scheduler.BuildCFG();
65 scheduler.ComputeSpecialRPONumbering();
66 scheduler.GenerateDominatorTree();
67
68 scheduler.PrepareUses();
69 scheduler.ScheduleEarly();
70 scheduler.ScheduleLate();
71
72 scheduler.SealFinalSchedule();
73
74 return schedule;
75}
76
77Scheduler::SchedulerData Scheduler::DefaultSchedulerData() {
78 SchedulerData def = {schedule_->start(), 0, kUnknown};
79 return def;
80}
81
82
83Scheduler::SchedulerData* Scheduler::GetData(Node* node) {
84 return &node_data_[node->id()];
85}
86
87Scheduler::Placement Scheduler::InitializePlacement(Node* node) {
88 SchedulerData* data = GetData(node);
89 if (data->placement_ == kFixed) {
90 // Nothing to do for control nodes that have been already fixed in
91 // the schedule.
92 return data->placement_;
93 }
94 DCHECK_EQ(kUnknown, data->placement_);
95 switch (node->opcode()) {
96 case IrOpcode::kParameter:
97 case IrOpcode::kOsrValue:
98 // Parameters and OSR values are always fixed to the start block.
99 data->placement_ = kFixed;
100 break;
101 case IrOpcode::kPhi:
102 case IrOpcode::kEffectPhi: {
103 // Phis and effect phis are fixed if their control inputs are, whereas
104 // otherwise they are coupled to a floating control node.
105 Placement p = GetPlacement(NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node));
106 data->placement_ = (p == kFixed ? kFixed : kCoupled);
107 break;
108 }
109 default:
110 // Control nodes that were not control-reachable from end may float.
111 data->placement_ = kSchedulable;
112 break;
113 }
114 return data->placement_;
115}
116
117Scheduler::Placement Scheduler::GetPlacement(Node* node) {
118 return GetData(node)->placement_;
119}
120
121bool Scheduler::IsLive(Node* node) { return GetPlacement(node) != kUnknown; }
122
123void Scheduler::UpdatePlacement(Node* node, Placement placement) {
124 SchedulerData* data = GetData(node);
125 if (data->placement_ == kUnknown) {
126 // We only update control nodes from {kUnknown} to {kFixed}. Ideally, we
127 // should check that {node} is a control node (including exceptional calls),
128 // but that is expensive.
129 DCHECK_EQ(Scheduler::kFixed, placement);
130 data->placement_ = placement;
131 return;
132 }
133
134 switch (node->opcode()) {
135 case IrOpcode::kParameter:
136 // Parameters are fixed once and for all.
137 UNREACHABLE();
138 case IrOpcode::kPhi:
139 case IrOpcode::kEffectPhi: {
140 // Phis and effect phis are coupled to their respective blocks.
141 DCHECK_EQ(Scheduler::kCoupled, data->placement_);
142 DCHECK_EQ(Scheduler::kFixed, placement);
143 Node* control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
144 BasicBlock* block = schedule_->block(control);
145 schedule_->AddNode(block, node);
146 break;
147 }
148#define DEFINE_CONTROL_CASE(V) case IrOpcode::k##V:
149 CONTROL_OP_LIST(DEFINE_CONTROL_CASE)
150#undef DEFINE_CONTROL_CASE
151 {
152 // Control nodes force coupled uses to be placed.
153 for (auto use : node->uses()) {
154 if (GetPlacement(use) == Scheduler::kCoupled) {
155 DCHECK_EQ(node, NodeProperties::GetControlInput(use));
156 UpdatePlacement(use, placement);
157 }
158 }
159 break;
160 }
161 default:
162 DCHECK_EQ(Scheduler::kSchedulable, data->placement_);
163 DCHECK_EQ(Scheduler::kScheduled, placement);
164 break;
165 }
166 // Reduce the use count of the node's inputs to potentially make them
167 // schedulable. If all the uses of a node have been scheduled, then the node
168 // itself can be scheduled.
169 base::Optional<int> coupled_control_edge = GetCoupledControlEdge(node);
170 for (Edge const edge : node->input_edges()) {
171 DCHECK_EQ(node, edge.from());
172 if (edge.index() != coupled_control_edge) {
173 DecrementUnscheduledUseCount(edge.to(), node);
174 }
175 }
176 data->placement_ = placement;
177}
178
179base::Optional<int> Scheduler::GetCoupledControlEdge(Node* node) {
180 if (GetPlacement(node) == kCoupled) {
181 return NodeProperties::FirstControlIndex(node);
182 }
183 return {};
184}
185
186void Scheduler::IncrementUnscheduledUseCount(Node* node, Node* from) {
187 // Tracking use counts for fixed nodes is useless.
188 if (GetPlacement(node) == kFixed) return;
189
190 // Use count for coupled nodes is summed up on their control.
191 if (GetPlacement(node) == kCoupled) {
192 node = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
193 DCHECK_NE(GetPlacement(node), Placement::kFixed);
194 DCHECK_NE(GetPlacement(node), Placement::kCoupled);
195 }
196
197 ++(GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_);
198 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) {
199 TRACE(" Use count of #%d:%s (used by #%d:%s)++ = %d\n", node->id(),
200 node->op()->mnemonic(), from->id(), from->op()->mnemonic(),
201 GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_);
202 }
203}
204
205void Scheduler::DecrementUnscheduledUseCount(Node* node, Node* from) {
206 // Tracking use counts for fixed nodes is useless.
207 if (GetPlacement(node) == kFixed) return;
208
209 // Use count for coupled nodes is summed up on their control.
210 if (GetPlacement(node) == kCoupled) {
211 node = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
212 DCHECK_NE(GetPlacement(node), Placement::kFixed);
213 DCHECK_NE(GetPlacement(node), Placement::kCoupled);
214 }
215
216 DCHECK_LT(0, GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_);
217 --(GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_);
218 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) {
219 TRACE(" Use count of #%d:%s (used by #%d:%s)-- = %d\n", node->id(),
220 node->op()->mnemonic(), from->id(), from->op()->mnemonic(),
221 GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_);
222 }
223 if (GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_ == 0) {
224 TRACE(" newly eligible #%d:%s\n", node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic());
225 schedule_queue_.push(node);
226 }
227}
228
229// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
230// Phase 1: Build control-flow graph.
231
232
233// Internal class to build a control flow graph (i.e the basic blocks and edges
234// between them within a Schedule) from the node graph. Visits control edges of
235// the graph backwards from an end node in order to find the connected control
236// subgraph, needed for scheduling.
237class CFGBuilder : public ZoneObject {
238 public:
239 CFGBuilder(Zone* zone, Scheduler* scheduler)
240 : zone_(zone),
241 scheduler_(scheduler),
242 schedule_(scheduler->schedule_),
243 queued_(scheduler->graph_, 2),
244 queue_(zone),
245 control_(zone),
246 component_entry_(nullptr),
247 component_start_(nullptr),
248 component_end_(nullptr) {}
249
250 // Run the control flow graph construction algorithm by walking the graph
251 // backwards from end through control edges, building and connecting the
252 // basic blocks for control nodes.
253 void Run() {
254 ResetDataStructures();
255 Queue(scheduler_->graph_->end());
256
257 while (!queue_.empty()) { // Breadth-first backwards traversal.
258 scheduler_->tick_counter_->TickAndMaybeEnterSafepoint();
259 Node* node = queue_.front();
260 queue_.pop();
261 int max = NodeProperties::PastControlIndex(node);
262 for (int i = NodeProperties::FirstControlIndex(node); i < max; i++) {
263 Queue(node->InputAt(i));
264 }
265 }
266
267 for (NodeVector::iterator i = control_.begin(); i != control_.end(); ++i) {
268 ConnectBlocks(*i); // Connect block to its predecessor/successors.
269 }
270 }
271
272 // Run the control flow graph construction for a minimal control-connected
273 // component ending in {exit} and merge that component into an existing
274 // control flow graph at the bottom of {block}.
275 void Run(BasicBlock* block, Node* exit) {
276 ResetDataStructures();
277 Queue(exit);
278
279 component_entry_ = nullptr;
280 component_start_ = block;
281 component_end_ = schedule_->block(exit);
282 scheduler_->equivalence_->Run(exit);
283 while (!queue_.empty()) { // Breadth-first backwards traversal.
284 scheduler_->tick_counter_->TickAndMaybeEnterSafepoint();
285 Node* node = queue_.front();
286 queue_.pop();
287
288 // Use control dependence equivalence to find a canonical single-entry
289 // single-exit region that makes up a minimal component to be scheduled.
290 if (IsSingleEntrySingleExitRegion(node, exit)) {
291 TRACE("Found SESE at #%d:%s\n", node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic());
292 DCHECK(!component_entry_);
293 component_entry_ = node;
294 continue;
295 }
296
297 int max = NodeProperties::PastControlIndex(node);
298 for (int i = NodeProperties::FirstControlIndex(node); i < max; i++) {
299 Queue(node->InputAt(i));
300 }
301 }
302 DCHECK(component_entry_);
303
304 for (NodeVector::iterator i = control_.begin(); i != control_.end(); ++i) {
305 ConnectBlocks(*i); // Connect block to its predecessor/successors.
306 }
307 }
308
309 private:
310 friend class ScheduleLateNodeVisitor;
311 friend class Scheduler;
312
313 void FixNode(BasicBlock* block, Node* node) {
314 schedule_->AddNode(block, node);
315 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kFixed);
316 }
317
318 void Queue(Node* node) {
319 // Mark the connected control nodes as they are queued.
320 if (!queued_.Get(node)) {
321 BuildBlocks(node);
322 queue_.push(node);
323 queued_.Set(node, true);
324 control_.push_back(node);
325 }
326 }
327
328 void BuildBlocks(Node* node) {
329 switch (node->opcode()) {
330 case IrOpcode::kEnd:
331 FixNode(schedule_->end(), node);
332 break;
333 case IrOpcode::kStart:
334 FixNode(schedule_->start(), node);
335 break;
336 case IrOpcode::kLoop:
337 case IrOpcode::kMerge:
338 BuildBlockForNode(node);
339 break;
340 case IrOpcode::kTerminate: {
341 // Put Terminate in the loop to which it refers.
342 Node* loop = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
343 BasicBlock* block = BuildBlockForNode(loop);
344 FixNode(block, node);
345 break;
346 }
347 case IrOpcode::kBranch:
348 case IrOpcode::kSwitch:
349 BuildBlocksForSuccessors(node);
350 break;
351#define BUILD_BLOCK_JS_CASE(Name, ...) case IrOpcode::k##Name:
352 JS_OP_LIST(BUILD_BLOCK_JS_CASE)
353// JS opcodes are just like calls => fall through.
354#undef BUILD_BLOCK_JS_CASE
355 case IrOpcode::kCall:
356 case IrOpcode::kFastApiCall:
357 if (NodeProperties::IsExceptionalCall(node)) {
358 BuildBlocksForSuccessors(node);
359 }
360 break;
361 default:
362 break;
363 }
364 }
365
366 void ConnectBlocks(Node* node) {
367 switch (node->opcode()) {
368 case IrOpcode::kLoop:
369 case IrOpcode::kMerge:
370 ConnectMerge(node);
371 break;
372 case IrOpcode::kBranch:
373 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kFixed);
374 ConnectBranch(node);
375 break;
376 case IrOpcode::kSwitch:
377 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kFixed);
378 ConnectSwitch(node);
379 break;
380 case IrOpcode::kDeoptimize:
381 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kFixed);
382 ConnectDeoptimize(node);
383 break;
384 case IrOpcode::kTailCall:
385 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kFixed);
386 ConnectTailCall(node);
387 break;
388 case IrOpcode::kReturn:
389 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kFixed);
390 ConnectReturn(node);
391 break;
392 case IrOpcode::kThrow:
393 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kFixed);
394 ConnectThrow(node);
395 break;
396#define CONNECT_BLOCK_JS_CASE(Name, ...) case IrOpcode::k##Name:
397 JS_OP_LIST(CONNECT_BLOCK_JS_CASE)
398// JS opcodes are just like calls => fall through.
399#undef CONNECT_BLOCK_JS_CASE
400 case IrOpcode::kCall:
401 case IrOpcode::kFastApiCall:
402 if (NodeProperties::IsExceptionalCall(node)) {
403 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kFixed);
404 ConnectCall(node);
405 }
406 break;
407 default:
408 break;
409 }
410 }
411
412 BasicBlock* BuildBlockForNode(Node* node) {
413 BasicBlock* block = schedule_->block(node);
414 if (block == nullptr) {
415 block = schedule_->NewBasicBlock();
416 TRACE("Create block id:%d for #%d:%s\n", block->id().ToInt(), node->id(),
417 node->op()->mnemonic());
418 FixNode(block, node);
419 }
420 return block;
421 }
422
423 void BuildBlocksForSuccessors(Node* node) {
424 size_t const successor_cnt = node->op()->ControlOutputCount();
425 Node** successors = zone_->AllocateArray<Node*>(successor_cnt);
426 NodeProperties::CollectControlProjections(node, successors, successor_cnt);
427 for (size_t index = 0; index < successor_cnt; ++index) {
428 BuildBlockForNode(successors[index]);
429 }
430 }
431
432 void CollectSuccessorBlocks(Node* node, BasicBlock** successor_blocks,
433 size_t successor_cnt) {
434 Node** successors = reinterpret_cast<Node**>(successor_blocks);
435 NodeProperties::CollectControlProjections(node, successors, successor_cnt);
436 for (size_t index = 0; index < successor_cnt; ++index) {
437 successor_blocks[index] = schedule_->block(successors[index]);
438 }
439 }
440
441 BasicBlock* FindPredecessorBlock(Node* node) {
442 BasicBlock* predecessor_block = nullptr;
443 while (true) {
444 predecessor_block = schedule_->block(node);
445 if (predecessor_block != nullptr) break;
446 node = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
447 }
448 return predecessor_block;
449 }
450
451 void ConnectCall(Node* call) {
452 BasicBlock* successor_blocks[2];
453 CollectSuccessorBlocks(call, successor_blocks, arraysize(successor_blocks));
454
455 // Consider the exception continuation to be deferred.
456 successor_blocks[1]->set_deferred(true);
457
458 Node* call_control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(call);
459 BasicBlock* call_block = FindPredecessorBlock(call_control);
460 TraceConnect(call, call_block, successor_blocks[0]);
461 TraceConnect(call, call_block, successor_blocks[1]);
462 schedule_->AddCall(call_block, call, successor_blocks[0],
463 successor_blocks[1]);
464 }
465
466 void ConnectBranch(Node* branch) {
467 BasicBlock* successor_blocks[2];
468 CollectSuccessorBlocks(branch, successor_blocks,
469 arraysize(successor_blocks));
470
471 BranchHint hint_from_profile = BranchHint::kNone;
472 if (const ProfileDataFromFile* profile_data = scheduler_->profile_data()) {
473 hint_from_profile =
474 profile_data->GetHint(successor_blocks[0]->id().ToSize(),
475 successor_blocks[1]->id().ToSize());
476 }
477
478 // Consider branch hints.
479 switch (hint_from_profile) {
480 case BranchHint::kNone:
481 switch (BranchHintOf(branch->op())) {
482 case BranchHint::kNone:
483 break;
484 case BranchHint::kTrue:
485 successor_blocks[1]->set_deferred(true);
486 break;
487 case BranchHint::kFalse:
488 successor_blocks[0]->set_deferred(true);
489 break;
490 }
491 break;
492 case BranchHint::kTrue:
493 successor_blocks[1]->set_deferred(true);
494 break;
495 case BranchHint::kFalse:
496 successor_blocks[0]->set_deferred(true);
497 break;
498 }
499
500 if (branch == component_entry_) {
501 TraceConnect(branch, component_start_, successor_blocks[0]);
502 TraceConnect(branch, component_start_, successor_blocks[1]);
503 schedule_->InsertBranch(component_start_, component_end_, branch,
504 successor_blocks[0], successor_blocks[1]);
505 } else {
506 Node* branch_control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(branch);
507 BasicBlock* branch_block = FindPredecessorBlock(branch_control);
508 TraceConnect(branch, branch_block, successor_blocks[0]);
509 TraceConnect(branch, branch_block, successor_blocks[1]);
510 schedule_->AddBranch(branch_block, branch, successor_blocks[0],
511 successor_blocks[1]);
512 }
513 }
514
515 void ConnectSwitch(Node* sw) {
516 size_t const successor_count = sw->op()->ControlOutputCount();
517 BasicBlock** successor_blocks =
518 zone_->AllocateArray<BasicBlock*>(successor_count);
519 CollectSuccessorBlocks(sw, successor_blocks, successor_count);
520
521 if (sw == component_entry_) {
522 for (size_t index = 0; index < successor_count; ++index) {
523 TraceConnect(sw, component_start_, successor_blocks[index]);
524 }
525 schedule_->InsertSwitch(component_start_, component_end_, sw,
526 successor_blocks, successor_count);
527 } else {
528 Node* switch_control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(sw);
529 BasicBlock* switch_block = FindPredecessorBlock(switch_control);
530 for (size_t index = 0; index < successor_count; ++index) {
531 TraceConnect(sw, switch_block, successor_blocks[index]);
532 }
533 schedule_->AddSwitch(switch_block, sw, successor_blocks, successor_count);
534 }
535 for (size_t index = 0; index < successor_count; ++index) {
536 if (BranchHintOf(successor_blocks[index]->front()->op()) ==
537 BranchHint::kFalse) {
538 successor_blocks[index]->set_deferred(true);
539 }
540 }
541 }
542
543 void ConnectMerge(Node* merge) {
544 // Don't connect the special merge at the end to its predecessors.
545 if (IsFinalMerge(merge)) return;
546
547 BasicBlock* block = schedule_->block(merge);
548 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(block);
549 // For all of the merge's control inputs, add a goto at the end to the
550 // merge's basic block.
551 for (Node* const input : merge->inputs()) {
552 BasicBlock* predecessor_block = FindPredecessorBlock(input);
553 TraceConnect(merge, predecessor_block, block);
554 schedule_->AddGoto(predecessor_block, block);
555 }
556 }
557
558 void ConnectTailCall(Node* call) {
559 Node* call_control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(call);
560 BasicBlock* call_block = FindPredecessorBlock(call_control);
561 TraceConnect(call, call_block, nullptr);
562 schedule_->AddTailCall(call_block, call);
563 }
564
565 void ConnectReturn(Node* ret) {
566 Node* return_control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(ret);
567 BasicBlock* return_block = FindPredecessorBlock(return_control);
568 TraceConnect(ret, return_block, nullptr);
569 schedule_->AddReturn(return_block, ret);
570 }
571
572 void ConnectDeoptimize(Node* deopt) {
573 Node* deoptimize_control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(deopt);
574 BasicBlock* deoptimize_block = FindPredecessorBlock(deoptimize_control);
575 TraceConnect(deopt, deoptimize_block, nullptr);
576 schedule_->AddDeoptimize(deoptimize_block, deopt);
577 }
578
579 void ConnectThrow(Node* thr) {
580 Node* throw_control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(thr);
581 BasicBlock* throw_block = FindPredecessorBlock(throw_control);
582 TraceConnect(thr, throw_block, nullptr);
583 schedule_->AddThrow(throw_block, thr);
584 }
585
586 void TraceConnect(Node* node, BasicBlock* block, BasicBlock* succ) {
587 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(block);
588 if (succ == nullptr) {
589 TRACE("Connect #%d:%s, id:%d -> end\n", node->id(),
590 node->op()->mnemonic(), block->id().ToInt());
591 } else {
592 TRACE("Connect #%d:%s, id:%d -> id:%d\n", node->id(),
593 node->op()->mnemonic(), block->id().ToInt(), succ->id().ToInt());
594 }
595 }
596
597 bool IsFinalMerge(Node* node) {
598 return (node->opcode() == IrOpcode::kMerge &&
599 node == scheduler_->graph_->end()->InputAt(0));
600 }
601
602 bool IsSingleEntrySingleExitRegion(Node* entry, Node* exit) const {
603 size_t entry_class = scheduler_->equivalence_->ClassOf(entry);
604 size_t exit_class = scheduler_->equivalence_->ClassOf(exit);
605 return entry != exit && entry_class == exit_class;
606 }
607
608 void ResetDataStructures() {
609 control_.clear();
610 DCHECK(queue_.empty());
611 DCHECK(control_.empty());
612 }
613
614 Zone* zone_;
615 Scheduler* scheduler_;
616 Schedule* schedule_;
617 NodeMarker<bool> queued_; // Mark indicating whether node is queued.
618 ZoneQueue<Node*> queue_; // Queue used for breadth-first traversal.
619 NodeVector control_; // List of encountered control nodes.
620 Node* component_entry_; // Component single-entry node.
621 BasicBlock* component_start_; // Component single-entry block.
622 BasicBlock* component_end_; // Component single-exit block.
623};
624
625
626void Scheduler::BuildCFG() {
627 TRACE("--- CREATING CFG -------------------------------------------\n");
628
629 // Instantiate a new control equivalence algorithm for the graph.
630 equivalence_ = zone_->New<ControlEquivalence>(zone_, graph_);
631
632 // Build a control-flow graph for the main control-connected component that
633 // is being spanned by the graph's start and end nodes.
634 control_flow_builder_ = zone_->New<CFGBuilder>(zone_, this);
635 control_flow_builder_->Run();
636
637 // Initialize per-block data.
638 // Reserve an extra 10% to avoid resizing vector when fusing floating control.
639 scheduled_nodes_.reserve(schedule_->BasicBlockCount() * 1.1);
640 scheduled_nodes_.resize(schedule_->BasicBlockCount());
641}
642
643
644// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
645// Phase 2: Compute special RPO and dominator tree.
646
647
648// Compute the special reverse-post-order block ordering, which is essentially
649// a RPO of the graph where loop bodies are contiguous. Properties:
650// 1. If block A is a predecessor of B, then A appears before B in the order,
651// unless B is a loop header and A is in the loop headed at B
652// (i.e. A -> B is a backedge).
653// => If block A dominates block B, then A appears before B in the order.
654// => If block A is a loop header, A appears before all blocks in the loop
655// headed at A.
656// 2. All loops are contiguous in the order (i.e. no intervening blocks that
657// do not belong to the loop.)
658// Note a simple RPO traversal satisfies (1) but not (2).
659class SpecialRPONumberer : public ZoneObject {
660 public:
661 SpecialRPONumberer(Zone* zone, Schedule* schedule)
662 : zone_(zone),
663 schedule_(schedule),
664 order_(nullptr),
665 beyond_end_(nullptr),
666 loops_(zone),
667 backedges_(zone),
668 stack_(zone),
669 previous_block_count_(0),
670 empty_(0, zone) {}
671
672 // Computes the special reverse-post-order for the main control flow graph,
673 // that is for the graph spanned between the schedule's start and end blocks.
674 void ComputeSpecialRPO() {
675 DCHECK_EQ(0, schedule_->end()->SuccessorCount());
676 DCHECK(!order_); // Main order does not exist yet.
677 ComputeAndInsertSpecialRPO(schedule_->start(), schedule_->end());
678 }
679
680 // Computes the special reverse-post-order for a partial control flow graph,
681 // that is for the graph spanned between the given {entry} and {end} blocks,
682 // then updates the existing ordering with this new information.
683 void UpdateSpecialRPO(BasicBlock* entry, BasicBlock* end) {
684 DCHECK(order_); // Main order to be updated is present.
685 ComputeAndInsertSpecialRPO(entry, end);
686 }
687
688 // Serialize the previously computed order as a special reverse-post-order
689 // numbering for basic blocks into the final schedule.
690 void SerializeRPOIntoSchedule() {
691 int32_t number = 0;
692 for (BasicBlock* b = order_; b != nullptr; b = b->rpo_next()) {
693 b->set_rpo_number(number++);
694 schedule_->rpo_order()->push_back(b);
695 }
696 BeyondEndSentinel()->set_rpo_number(number);
697 }
698
699 // Print and verify the special reverse-post-order.
700 void PrintAndVerifySpecialRPO() {
701#if DEBUG
702 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) PrintRPO();
703 VerifySpecialRPO();
704#endif
705 }
706
707 const ZoneVector<BasicBlock*>& GetOutgoingBlocks(BasicBlock* block) {
708 if (HasLoopNumber(block)) {
709 LoopInfo const& loop = loops_[GetLoopNumber(block)];
710 if (loop.outgoing) return *loop.outgoing;
711 }
712 return empty_;
713 }
714
715 bool HasLoopBlocks() const { return !loops_.empty(); }
716
717 private:
718 using Backedge = std::pair<BasicBlock*, size_t>;
719
720 // Numbering for BasicBlock::rpo_number for this block traversal:
721 static const int kBlockOnStack = -2;
722 static const int kBlockVisited1 = -3;
723 static const int kBlockVisited2 = -4;
724 static const int kBlockUnvisited1 = -1;
725 static const int kBlockUnvisited2 = kBlockVisited1;
726
727 struct SpecialRPOStackFrame {
728 BasicBlock* block;
729 size_t index;
730 };
731
732 struct LoopInfo {
733 BasicBlock* header;
734 ZoneVector<BasicBlock*>* outgoing;
735 BitVector* members;
736 LoopInfo* prev;
737 BasicBlock* end;
738 BasicBlock* start;
739
740 void AddOutgoing(Zone* zone, BasicBlock* block) {
741 if (outgoing == nullptr) {
742 outgoing = zone->New<ZoneVector<BasicBlock*>>(zone);
743 }
744 outgoing->push_back(block);
745 }
746 };
747
748 int Push(int depth, BasicBlock* child, int unvisited) {
749 if (child->rpo_number() == unvisited) {
750 stack_[depth].block = child;
751 stack_[depth].index = 0;
752 child->set_rpo_number(kBlockOnStack);
753 return depth + 1;
754 }
755 return depth;
756 }
757
758 BasicBlock* PushFront(BasicBlock* head, BasicBlock* block) {
759 block->set_rpo_next(head);
760 return block;
761 }
762
763 static int GetLoopNumber(BasicBlock* block) { return block->loop_number(); }
764 static void SetLoopNumber(BasicBlock* block, int loop_number) {
765 return block->set_loop_number(loop_number);
766 }
767 static bool HasLoopNumber(BasicBlock* block) {
768 return block->loop_number() >= 0;
769 }
770
771 // We only need this special sentinel because some tests use the schedule's
772 // end block in actual control flow (e.g. with end having successors).
773 BasicBlock* BeyondEndSentinel() {
774 if (beyond_end_ == nullptr) {
775 BasicBlock::Id id = BasicBlock::Id::FromInt(-1);
776 beyond_end_ = schedule_->zone()->New<BasicBlock>(schedule_->zone(), id);
777 }
778 return beyond_end_;
779 }
780
781 // Compute special RPO for the control flow graph between {entry} and {end},
782 // mutating any existing order so that the result is still valid.
783 void ComputeAndInsertSpecialRPO(BasicBlock* entry, BasicBlock* end) {
784 // RPO should not have been serialized for this schedule yet.
785 CHECK_EQ(kBlockUnvisited1, schedule_->start()->loop_number());
786 CHECK_EQ(kBlockUnvisited1, schedule_->start()->rpo_number());
787 CHECK_EQ(0, static_cast<int>(schedule_->rpo_order()->size()));
788
789 // Find correct insertion point within existing order.
790 BasicBlock* insertion_point = entry->rpo_next();
791 BasicBlock* order = insertion_point;
792
793 // Perform an iterative RPO traversal using an explicit stack,
794 // recording backedges that form cycles. O(|B|).
795 DCHECK_LT(previous_block_count_, schedule_->BasicBlockCount());
796 stack_.resize(schedule_->BasicBlockCount() - previous_block_count_);
797 previous_block_count_ = schedule_->BasicBlockCount();
798 int stack_depth = Push(0, entry, kBlockUnvisited1);
799 int num_loops = static_cast<int>(loops_.size());
800
801 while (stack_depth > 0) {
802 int current = stack_depth - 1;
803 SpecialRPOStackFrame* frame = &stack_[current];
804
805 if (frame->block != end &&
806 frame->index < frame->block->SuccessorCount()) {
807 // Process the next successor.
808 BasicBlock* succ = frame->block->SuccessorAt(frame->index++);
809 if (succ->rpo_number() == kBlockVisited1) continue;
810 if (succ->rpo_number() == kBlockOnStack) {
811 // The successor is on the stack, so this is a backedge (cycle).
812 backedges_.push_back(Backedge(frame->block, frame->index - 1));
813 if (!HasLoopNumber(succ)) {
814 // Assign a new loop number to the header if it doesn't have one.
815 SetLoopNumber(succ, num_loops++);
816 }
817 } else {
818 // Push the successor onto the stack.
819 DCHECK_EQ(kBlockUnvisited1, succ->rpo_number());
820 stack_depth = Push(stack_depth, succ, kBlockUnvisited1);
821 }
822 } else {
823 // Finished with all successors; pop the stack and add the block.
824 order = PushFront(order, frame->block);
825 frame->block->set_rpo_number(kBlockVisited1);
826 stack_depth--;
827 }
828 }
829
830 // If no loops were encountered, then the order we computed was correct.
831 if (num_loops > static_cast<int>(loops_.size())) {
832 // Otherwise, compute the loop information from the backedges in order
833 // to perform a traversal that groups loop bodies together.
834 ComputeLoopInfo(&stack_, num_loops, &backedges_);
835
836 // Initialize the "loop stack". Note the entry could be a loop header.
837 LoopInfo* loop =
838 HasLoopNumber(entry) ? &loops_[GetLoopNumber(entry)] : nullptr;
839 order = insertion_point;
840
841 // Perform an iterative post-order traversal, visiting loop bodies before
842 // edges that lead out of loops. Visits each block once, but linking loop
843 // sections together is linear in the loop size, so overall is
844 // O(|B| + max(loop_depth) * max(|loop|))
845 stack_depth = Push(0, entry, kBlockUnvisited2);
846 while (stack_depth > 0) {
847 SpecialRPOStackFrame* frame = &stack_[stack_depth - 1];
848 BasicBlock* block = frame->block;
849 BasicBlock* succ = nullptr;
850
851 if (block != end && frame->index < block->SuccessorCount()) {
852 // Process the next normal successor.
853 succ = block->SuccessorAt(frame->index++);
854 } else if (HasLoopNumber(block)) {
855 // Process additional outgoing edges from the loop header.
856 if (block->rpo_number() == kBlockOnStack) {
857 // Finish the loop body the first time the header is left on the
858 // stack.
859 DCHECK(loop != nullptr && loop->header == block);
860 loop->start = PushFront(order, block);
861 order = loop->end;
862 block->set_rpo_number(kBlockVisited2);
863 // Pop the loop stack and continue visiting outgoing edges within
864 // the context of the outer loop, if any.
865 loop = loop->prev;
866 // We leave the loop header on the stack; the rest of this iteration
867 // and later iterations will go through its outgoing edges list.
868 }
869
870 // Use the next outgoing edge if there are any.
871 size_t outgoing_index = frame->index - block->SuccessorCount();
872 LoopInfo* info = &loops_[GetLoopNumber(block)];
873 DCHECK(loop != info);
874 if (block != entry && info->outgoing != nullptr &&
875 outgoing_index < info->outgoing->size()) {
876 succ = info->outgoing->at(outgoing_index);
877 frame->index++;
878 }
879 }
880
881 if (succ != nullptr) {
882 // Process the next successor.
883 if (succ->rpo_number() == kBlockOnStack) continue;
884 if (succ->rpo_number() == kBlockVisited2) continue;
885 DCHECK_EQ(kBlockUnvisited2, succ->rpo_number());
886 if (loop != nullptr && !loop->members->Contains(succ->id().ToInt())) {
887 // The successor is not in the current loop or any nested loop.
888 // Add it to the outgoing edges of this loop and visit it later.
889 loop->AddOutgoing(zone_, succ);
890 } else {
891 // Push the successor onto the stack.
892 stack_depth = Push(stack_depth, succ, kBlockUnvisited2);
893 if (HasLoopNumber(succ)) {
894 // Push the inner loop onto the loop stack.
895 DCHECK(GetLoopNumber(succ) < num_loops);
896 LoopInfo* next = &loops_[GetLoopNumber(succ)];
897 next->end = order;
898 next->prev = loop;
899 loop = next;
900 }
901 }
902 } else {
903 // Finished with all successors of the current block.
904 if (HasLoopNumber(block)) {
905 // If we are going to pop a loop header, then add its entire body.
906 LoopInfo* info = &loops_[GetLoopNumber(block)];
907 for (BasicBlock* b = info->start; true; b = b->rpo_next()) {
908 if (b->rpo_next() == info->end) {
909 b->set_rpo_next(order);
910 info->end = order;
911 break;
912 }
913 }
914 order = info->start;
915 } else {
916 // Pop a single node off the stack and add it to the order.
917 order = PushFront(order, block);
918 block->set_rpo_number(kBlockVisited2);
919 }
920 stack_depth--;
921 }
922 }
923 }
924
925 // Publish new order the first time.
926 if (order_ == nullptr) order_ = order;
927
928 // Compute the correct loop headers and set the correct loop ends.
929 LoopInfo* current_loop = nullptr;
930 BasicBlock* current_header = entry->loop_header();
931 int32_t loop_depth = entry->loop_depth();
932 if (entry->IsLoopHeader()) --loop_depth; // Entry might be a loop header.
933 for (BasicBlock* b = order; b != insertion_point; b = b->rpo_next()) {
934 BasicBlock* current = b;
935
936 // Reset BasicBlock::rpo_number again.
937 current->set_rpo_number(kBlockUnvisited1);
938
939 // Finish the previous loop(s) if we just exited them.
940 while (current_header != nullptr &&
941 current == current_header->loop_end()) {
942 DCHECK(current_header->IsLoopHeader());
943 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(current_loop);
944 current_loop = current_loop->prev;
945 current_header =
946 current_loop == nullptr ? nullptr : current_loop->header;
947 --loop_depth;
948 }
949 current->set_loop_header(current_header);
950
951 // Push a new loop onto the stack if this loop is a loop header.
952 if (HasLoopNumber(current)) {
953 ++loop_depth;
954 current_loop = &loops_[GetLoopNumber(current)];
955 BasicBlock* loop_end = current_loop->end;
956 current->set_loop_end(loop_end == nullptr ? BeyondEndSentinel()
957 : loop_end);
958 current_header = current_loop->header;
959 TRACE("id:%d is a loop header, increment loop depth to %d\n",
960 current->id().ToInt(), loop_depth);
961 }
962
963 current->set_loop_depth(loop_depth);
964
965 if (current->loop_header() == nullptr) {
966 TRACE("id:%d is not in a loop (depth == %d)\n", current->id().ToInt(),
967 current->loop_depth());
968 } else {
969 TRACE("id:%d has loop header id:%d, (depth == %d)\n",
970 current->id().ToInt(), current->loop_header()->id().ToInt(),
971 current->loop_depth());
972 }
973 }
974 }
975
976 // Computes loop membership from the backedges of the control flow graph.
977 void ComputeLoopInfo(ZoneVector<SpecialRPOStackFrame>* queue,
978 size_t num_loops, ZoneVector<Backedge>* backedges) {
979 // Extend existing loop membership vectors.
980 for (LoopInfo& loop : loops_) {
981 loop.members->Resize(static_cast<int>(schedule_->BasicBlockCount()),
982 zone_);
983 }
984
985 // Extend loop information vector.
986 loops_.resize(num_loops, LoopInfo());
987
988 // Compute loop membership starting from backedges.
989 // O(max(loop_depth) * max(|loop|)
990 for (size_t i = 0; i < backedges->size(); i++) {
991 BasicBlock* member = backedges->at(i).first;
992 BasicBlock* header = member->SuccessorAt(backedges->at(i).second);
993 size_t loop_num = GetLoopNumber(header);
994 if (loops_[loop_num].header == nullptr) {
995 loops_[loop_num].header = header;
996 loops_[loop_num].members = zone_->New<BitVector>(
997 static_cast<int>(schedule_->BasicBlockCount()), zone_);
998 }
999
1000 int queue_length = 0;
1001 if (member != header) {
1002 // As long as the header doesn't have a backedge to itself,
1003 // Push the member onto the queue and process its predecessors.
1004 if (!loops_[loop_num].members->Contains(member->id().ToInt())) {
1005 loops_[loop_num].members->Add(member->id().ToInt());
1006 }
1007 (*queue)[queue_length++].block = member;
1008 }
1009
1010 // Propagate loop membership backwards. All predecessors of M up to the
1011 // loop header H are members of the loop too. O(|blocks between M and H|).
1012 while (queue_length > 0) {
1013 BasicBlock* block = (*queue)[--queue_length].block;
1014 for (size_t j = 0; j < block->PredecessorCount(); j++) {
1015 BasicBlock* pred = block->PredecessorAt(j);
1016 if (pred != header) {
1017 if (!loops_[loop_num].members->Contains(pred->id().ToInt())) {
1018 loops_[loop_num].members->Add(pred->id().ToInt());
1019 (*queue)[queue_length++].block = pred;
1020 }
1021 }
1022 }
1023 }
1024 }
1025 }
1026
1027#if DEBUG
1028 void PrintRPO() {
1029 StdoutStream os;
1030 os << "RPO with " << loops_.size() << " loops";
1031 if (loops_.size() > 0) {
1032 os << " (";
1033 for (size_t i = 0; i < loops_.size(); i++) {
1034 if (i > 0) os << " ";
1035 os << "id:" << loops_[i].header->id();
1036 }
1037 os << ")";
1038 }
1039 os << ":\n";
1040
1041 for (BasicBlock* block = order_; block != nullptr;
1042 block = block->rpo_next()) {
1043 os << std::setw(5) << "B" << block->rpo_number() << ":";
1044 for (size_t i = 0; i < loops_.size(); i++) {
1045 bool range = loops_[i].header->LoopContains(block);
1046 bool membership = loops_[i].header != block && range;
1047 os << (membership ? " |" : " ");
1048 os << (range ? "x" : " ");
1049 }
1050 os << " id:" << block->id() << ": ";
1051 if (block->loop_end() != nullptr) {
1052 os << " range: [B" << block->rpo_number() << ", B"
1053 << block->loop_end()->rpo_number() << ")";
1054 }
1055 if (block->loop_header() != nullptr) {
1056 os << " header: id:" << block->loop_header()->id();
1057 }
1058 if (block->loop_depth() > 0) {
1059 os << " depth: " << block->loop_depth();
1060 }
1061 os << "\n";
1062 }
1063 }
1064
1065 void VerifySpecialRPO() {
1066 BasicBlockVector* order = schedule_->rpo_order();
1067 DCHECK_LT(0, order->size());
1068 DCHECK_EQ(0, (*order)[0]->id().ToInt()); // entry should be first.
1069
1070 for (size_t i = 0; i < loops_.size(); i++) {
1071 LoopInfo* loop = &loops_[i];
1072 BasicBlock* header = loop->header;
1073 BasicBlock* end = header->loop_end();
1074
1075 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(header);
1076 DCHECK_LE(0, header->rpo_number());
1077 DCHECK_LT(header->rpo_number(), order->size());
1078 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(end);
1079 DCHECK_LE(end->rpo_number(), order->size());
1080 DCHECK_GT(end->rpo_number(), header->rpo_number());
1081 DCHECK_NE(header->loop_header(), header);
1082
1083 // Verify the start ... end list relationship.
1084 int links = 0;
1085 BasicBlock* block = loop->start;
1086 DCHECK_EQ(header, block);
1087 bool end_found;
1088 while (true) {
1089 if (block == nullptr || block == loop->end) {
1090 end_found = (loop->end == block);
1091 break;
1092 }
1093 // The list should be in same order as the final result.
1094 DCHECK(block->rpo_number() == links + header->rpo_number());
1095 links++;
1096 block = block->rpo_next();
1097 DCHECK_LT(links, static_cast<int>(2 * order->size())); // cycle?
1098 }
1099 DCHECK_LT(0, links);
1100 DCHECK_EQ(links, end->rpo_number() - header->rpo_number());
1101 DCHECK(end_found);
1102
1103 // Check loop depth of the header.
1104 int loop_depth = 0;
1105 for (LoopInfo* outer = loop; outer != nullptr; outer = outer->prev) {
1106 loop_depth++;
1107 }
1108 DCHECK_EQ(loop_depth, header->loop_depth());
1109
1110 // Check the contiguousness of loops.
1111 int count = 0;
1112 for (int j = 0; j < static_cast<int>(order->size()); j++) {
1113 block = order->at(j);
1114 DCHECK_EQ(block->rpo_number(), j);
1115 if (j < header->rpo_number() || j >= end->rpo_number()) {
1116 DCHECK(!header->LoopContains(block));
1117 } else {
1118 DCHECK(header->LoopContains(block));
1119 DCHECK_GE(block->loop_depth(), loop_depth);
1120 count++;
1121 }
1122 }
1123 DCHECK_EQ(links, count);
1124 }
1125 }
1126#endif // DEBUG
1127
1128 Zone* zone_;
1129 Schedule* schedule_;
1130 BasicBlock* order_;
1131 BasicBlock* beyond_end_;
1132 ZoneVector<LoopInfo> loops_;
1133 ZoneVector<Backedge> backedges_;
1134 ZoneVector<SpecialRPOStackFrame> stack_;
1135 size_t previous_block_count_;
1136 ZoneVector<BasicBlock*> const empty_;
1137};
1138
1139
1140BasicBlockVector* Scheduler::ComputeSpecialRPO(Zone* zone, Schedule* schedule) {
1141 SpecialRPONumberer numberer(zone, schedule);
1142 numberer.ComputeSpecialRPO();
1143 numberer.SerializeRPOIntoSchedule();
1144 numberer.PrintAndVerifySpecialRPO();
1145 return schedule->rpo_order();
1146}
1147
1148
1149void Scheduler::ComputeSpecialRPONumbering() {
1150 TRACE("--- COMPUTING SPECIAL RPO ----------------------------------\n");
1151
1152 // Compute the special reverse-post-order for basic blocks.
1153 special_rpo_ = zone_->New<SpecialRPONumberer>(zone_, schedule_);
1154 special_rpo_->ComputeSpecialRPO();
1155}
1156
1157BasicBlock* Scheduler::GetCommonDominatorIfCached(BasicBlock* b1,
1158 BasicBlock* b2) {
1159 auto entry1 = common_dominator_cache_.find(b1->id().ToInt());
1160 if (entry1 == common_dominator_cache_.end()) return nullptr;
1161 auto entry2 = entry1->second->find(b2->id().ToInt());
1162 if (entry2 == entry1->second->end()) return nullptr;
1163 return entry2->second;
1164}
1165
1166BasicBlock* Scheduler::GetCommonDominator(BasicBlock* b1, BasicBlock* b2) {
1167 // A very common fast case:
1168 if (b1 == b2) return b1;
1169 // Try to find the common dominator by walking, if there is a chance of
1170 // finding it quickly.
1171 constexpr int kCacheGranularity = 63;
1172 static_assert((kCacheGranularity & (kCacheGranularity + 1)) == 0);
1173 int depth_difference = b1->dominator_depth() - b2->dominator_depth();
1174 if (depth_difference > -kCacheGranularity &&
1175 depth_difference < kCacheGranularity) {
1176 for (int i = 0; i < kCacheGranularity; i++) {
1177 if (b1->dominator_depth() < b2->dominator_depth()) {
1178 b2 = b2->dominator();
1179 } else {
1180 b1 = b1->dominator();
1181 }
1182 if (b1 == b2) return b1;
1183 }
1184 // We might fall out of the loop here if the dominator tree has several
1185 // deep "parallel" subtrees.
1186 }
1187 // If it'd be a long walk, take the bus instead (i.e. use the cache).
1188 // To keep memory consumption low, there'll be a bus stop every 64 blocks.
1189 // First, walk to the nearest bus stop.
1190 if (b1->dominator_depth() < b2->dominator_depth()) std::swap(b1, b2);
1191 while ((b1->dominator_depth() & kCacheGranularity) != 0) {
1192 if (V8_LIKELY(b1->dominator_depth() > b2->dominator_depth())) {
1193 b1 = b1->dominator();
1194 } else {
1195 b2 = b2->dominator();
1196 }
1197 if (b1 == b2) return b1;
1198 }
1199 // Then, walk from bus stop to bus stop until we either find a bus (i.e. an
1200 // existing cache entry) or the result. Make a list of any empty bus stops
1201 // we'd like to populate for next time.
1202 constexpr int kMaxNewCacheEntries = 2 * 50; // Must be even.
1203 // This array stores a flattened list of pairs, e.g. if after finding the
1204 // {result}, we want to cache [(B11, B12) -> result, (B21, B22) -> result],
1205 // then we store [11, 12, 21, 22] here.
1206 int new_cache_entries[kMaxNewCacheEntries];
1207 // Next free slot in {new_cache_entries}.
1208 int new_cache_entries_cursor = 0;
1209 while (b1 != b2) {
1210 if ((b1->dominator_depth() & kCacheGranularity) == 0) {
1211 BasicBlock* maybe_cache_hit = GetCommonDominatorIfCached(b1, b2);
1212 if (maybe_cache_hit != nullptr) {
1213 b1 = b2 = maybe_cache_hit;
1214 break;
1215 } else if (new_cache_entries_cursor < kMaxNewCacheEntries) {
1216 new_cache_entries[new_cache_entries_cursor++] = b1->id().ToInt();
1217 new_cache_entries[new_cache_entries_cursor++] = b2->id().ToInt();
1218 }
1219 }
1220 if (V8_LIKELY(b1->dominator_depth() > b2->dominator_depth())) {
1221 b1 = b1->dominator();
1222 } else {
1223 b2 = b2->dominator();
1224 }
1225 }
1226 // Lastly, create new cache entries we noted down earlier.
1227 BasicBlock* result = b1;
1228 for (int i = 0; i < new_cache_entries_cursor;) {
1229 int id1 = new_cache_entries[i++];
1230 int id2 = new_cache_entries[i++];
1231 ZoneMap<int, BasicBlock*>* mapping;
1232 auto entry = common_dominator_cache_.find(id1);
1233 if (entry == common_dominator_cache_.end()) {
1234 mapping = zone_->New<ZoneMap<int, BasicBlock*>>(zone_);
1235 common_dominator_cache_[id1] = mapping;
1236 } else {
1237 mapping = entry->second;
1238 }
1239 // If there was an existing entry, we would have found it earlier.
1240 DCHECK_EQ(mapping->find(id2), mapping->end());
1241 mapping->insert({id2, result});
1242 }
1243 return result;
1244}
1245
1246void Scheduler::PropagateImmediateDominators(BasicBlock* block) {
1247 for (/*nop*/; block != nullptr; block = block->rpo_next()) {
1248 auto pred = block->predecessors().begin();
1249 auto end = block->predecessors().end();
1250 DCHECK(pred != end); // All blocks except start have predecessors.
1251 BasicBlock* dominator = *pred;
1252 bool deferred = dominator->deferred();
1253 // For multiple predecessors, walk up the dominator tree until a common
1254 // dominator is found. Visitation order guarantees that all predecessors
1255 // except for backwards edges have been visited.
1256 // We use a one-element cache for previously-seen dominators. This gets
1257 // hit a lot for functions that have long chains of diamonds, and in
1258 // those cases turns quadratic into linear complexity.
1259 BasicBlock* cache = nullptr;
1260 for (++pred; pred != end; ++pred) {
1261 // Don't examine backwards edges.
1262 if ((*pred)->dominator_depth() < 0) continue;
1263 if ((*pred)->dominator_depth() > 3 &&
1264 ((*pred)->dominator()->dominator() == cache ||
1265 (*pred)->dominator()->dominator()->dominator() == cache)) {
1266 // Nothing to do, the last iteration covered this case.
1267 DCHECK_EQ(dominator, BasicBlock::GetCommonDominator(dominator, *pred));
1268 } else {
1269 dominator = BasicBlock::GetCommonDominator(dominator, *pred);
1270 }
1271 cache = (*pred)->dominator();
1272 deferred = deferred & (*pred)->deferred();
1273 }
1274 block->set_dominator(dominator);
1275 block->set_dominator_depth(dominator->dominator_depth() + 1);
1276 block->set_deferred(deferred | block->deferred());
1277 TRACE("Block id:%d's idom is id:%d, depth = %d\n", block->id().ToInt(),
1278 dominator->id().ToInt(), block->dominator_depth());
1279 }
1280}
1281
1282void Scheduler::GenerateDominatorTree(Schedule* schedule) {
1283 // Seed start block to be the first dominator.
1284 schedule->start()->set_dominator_depth(0);
1285
1286 // Build the block dominator tree resulting from the above seed.
1287 PropagateImmediateDominators(schedule->start()->rpo_next());
1288}
1289
1290void Scheduler::GenerateDominatorTree() {
1291 TRACE("--- IMMEDIATE BLOCK DOMINATORS -----------------------------\n");
1292 GenerateDominatorTree(schedule_);
1293}
1294
1295// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1296// Phase 3: Prepare use counts for nodes.
1297
1298
1299class PrepareUsesVisitor {
1300 public:
1301 explicit PrepareUsesVisitor(Scheduler* scheduler, Graph* graph, Zone* zone)
1302 : scheduler_(scheduler),
1303 schedule_(scheduler->schedule_),
1304 graph_(graph),
1305 visited_(static_cast<int>(graph_->NodeCount()), zone),
1306 stack_(zone) {}
1307
1308 void Run() {
1309 InitializePlacement(graph_->end());
1310 while (!stack_.empty()) {
1311 Node* node = stack_.top();
1312 stack_.pop();
1313 VisitInputs(node);
1314 }
1315 }
1316
1317 private:
1318 void InitializePlacement(Node* node) {
1319 TRACE("Pre #%d:%s\n", node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic());
1320 DCHECK(!Visited(node));
1321 if (scheduler_->InitializePlacement(node) == Scheduler::kFixed) {
1322 // Fixed nodes are always roots for schedule late.
1323 scheduler_->schedule_root_nodes_.push_back(node);
1324 if (!schedule_->IsScheduled(node)) {
1325 // Make sure root nodes are scheduled in their respective blocks.
1326 TRACE("Scheduling fixed position node #%d:%s\n", node->id(),
1327 node->op()->mnemonic());
1328 IrOpcode::Value opcode = node->opcode();
1329 BasicBlock* block =
1330 opcode == IrOpcode::kParameter
1331 ? schedule_->start()
1332 : schedule_->block(NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node));
1333 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(block);
1334 schedule_->AddNode(block, node);
1335 }
1336 }
1337 stack_.push(node);
1338 visited_.Add(node->id());
1339 }
1340
1341 void VisitInputs(Node* node) {
1342 DCHECK_NE(scheduler_->GetPlacement(node), Scheduler::kUnknown);
1343 bool is_scheduled = schedule_->IsScheduled(node);
1344 base::Optional<int> coupled_control_edge =
1345 scheduler_->GetCoupledControlEdge(node);
1346 for (auto edge : node->input_edges()) {
1347 Node* to = edge.to();
1348 DCHECK_EQ(node, edge.from());
1349 if (!Visited(to)) {
1350 InitializePlacement(to);
1351 }
1352 TRACE("PostEdge #%d:%s->#%d:%s\n", node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic(),
1353 to->id(), to->op()->mnemonic());
1354 DCHECK_NE(scheduler_->GetPlacement(to), Scheduler::kUnknown);
1355 if (!is_scheduled && edge.index() != coupled_control_edge) {
1356 scheduler_->IncrementUnscheduledUseCount(to, node);
1357 }
1358 }
1359 }
1360
1361 bool Visited(Node* node) { return visited_.Contains(node->id()); }
1362
1363 Scheduler* scheduler_;
1364 Schedule* schedule_;
1365 Graph* graph_;
1366 BitVector visited_;
1367 ZoneStack<Node*> stack_;
1368};
1369
1370
1371void Scheduler::PrepareUses() {
1372 TRACE("--- PREPARE USES -------------------------------------------\n");
1373
1374 // Count the uses of every node, which is used to ensure that all of a
1375 // node's uses are scheduled before the node itself.
1376 PrepareUsesVisitor prepare_uses(this, graph_, zone_);
1377 prepare_uses.Run();
1378}
1379
1380
1381// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1382// Phase 4: Schedule nodes early.
1383
1384
1385class ScheduleEarlyNodeVisitor {
1386 public:
1387 ScheduleEarlyNodeVisitor(Zone* zone, Scheduler* scheduler)
1388 : scheduler_(scheduler), schedule_(scheduler->schedule_), queue_(zone) {}
1389
1390 // Run the schedule early algorithm on a set of fixed root nodes.
1391 void Run(NodeVector* roots) {
1392 for (Node* const root : *roots) {
1393 queue_.push(root);
1394 }
1395
1396 while (!queue_.empty()) {
1397 scheduler_->tick_counter_->TickAndMaybeEnterSafepoint();
1398 VisitNode(queue_.front());
1399 queue_.pop();
1400 }
1401 }
1402
1403 private:
1404 // Visits one node from the queue and propagates its current schedule early
1405 // position to all uses. This in turn might push more nodes onto the queue.
1406 void VisitNode(Node* node) {
1407 Scheduler::SchedulerData* data = scheduler_->GetData(node);
1408
1409 // Fixed nodes already know their schedule early position.
1410 if (scheduler_->GetPlacement(node) == Scheduler::kFixed) {
1411 data->minimum_block_ = schedule_->block(node);
1412 TRACE("Fixing #%d:%s minimum_block = id:%d, dominator_depth = %d\n",
1413 node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic(),
1414 data->minimum_block_->id().ToInt(),
1415 data->minimum_block_->dominator_depth());
1416 }
1417
1418 // No need to propagate unconstrained schedule early positions.
1419 if (data->minimum_block_ == schedule_->start()) return;
1420
1421 // Propagate schedule early position.
1422 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(data->minimum_block_);
1423 for (auto use : node->uses()) {
1424 if (scheduler_->IsLive(use)) {
1425 PropagateMinimumPositionToNode(data->minimum_block_, use);
1426 }
1427 }
1428 }
1429
1430 // Propagates {block} as another minimum position into the given {node}. This
1431 // has the net effect of computing the minimum dominator block of {node} that
1432 // still post-dominates all inputs to {node} when the queue is processed.
1433 void PropagateMinimumPositionToNode(BasicBlock* block, Node* node) {
1434 Scheduler::SchedulerData* data = scheduler_->GetData(node);
1435
1436 // No need to propagate to fixed node, it's guaranteed to be a root.
1437 if (scheduler_->GetPlacement(node) == Scheduler::kFixed) return;
1438
1439 // Coupled nodes influence schedule early position of their control.
1440 if (scheduler_->GetPlacement(node) == Scheduler::kCoupled) {
1441 Node* control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
1442 PropagateMinimumPositionToNode(block, control);
1443 }
1444
1445 // Propagate new position if it is deeper down the dominator tree than the
1446 // current. Note that all inputs need to have minimum block position inside
1447 // the dominator chain of {node}'s minimum block position.
1448 DCHECK(InsideSameDominatorChain(block, data->minimum_block_));
1449 if (block->dominator_depth() > data->minimum_block_->dominator_depth()) {
1450 data->minimum_block_ = block;
1451 queue_.push(node);
1452 TRACE("Propagating #%d:%s minimum_block = id:%d, dominator_depth = %d\n",
1453 node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic(),
1454 data->minimum_block_->id().ToInt(),
1455 data->minimum_block_->dominator_depth());
1456 }
1457 }
1458
1459#if DEBUG
1460 bool InsideSameDominatorChain(BasicBlock* b1, BasicBlock* b2) {
1461 BasicBlock* dominator = BasicBlock::GetCommonDominator(b1, b2);
1462 return dominator == b1 || dominator == b2;
1463 }
1464#endif
1465
1466 Scheduler* scheduler_;
1467 Schedule* schedule_;
1468 ZoneQueue<Node*> queue_;
1469};
1470
1471
1472void Scheduler::ScheduleEarly() {
1473 if (!special_rpo_->HasLoopBlocks()) {
1474 TRACE("--- NO LOOPS SO SKIPPING SCHEDULE EARLY --------------------\n");
1475 return;
1476 }
1477
1478 TRACE("--- SCHEDULE EARLY -----------------------------------------\n");
1479 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) {
1480 TRACE("roots: ");
1481 for (Node* node : schedule_root_nodes_) {
1482 TRACE("#%d:%s ", node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic());
1483 }
1484 TRACE("\n");
1485 }
1486
1487 // Compute the minimum block for each node thereby determining the earliest
1488 // position each node could be placed within a valid schedule.
1489 ScheduleEarlyNodeVisitor schedule_early_visitor(zone_, this);
1490 schedule_early_visitor.Run(&schedule_root_nodes_);
1491}
1492
1493
1494// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1495// Phase 5: Schedule nodes late.
1496
1497
1498class ScheduleLateNodeVisitor {
1499 public:
1500 ScheduleLateNodeVisitor(Zone* zone, Scheduler* scheduler)
1501 : zone_(zone),
1502 scheduler_(scheduler),
1503 schedule_(scheduler_->schedule_),
1504 marking_queue_(scheduler->zone_) {}
1505
1506 // Run the schedule late algorithm on a set of fixed root nodes.
1507 void Run(NodeVector* roots) {
1508 for (Node* const root : *roots) {
1509 ProcessQueue(root);
1510 }
1511 }
1512
1513 private:
1514 void ProcessQueue(Node* root) {
1515 ZoneQueue<Node*>* queue = &(scheduler_->schedule_queue_);
1516 for (Node* node : root->inputs()) {
1517 // Don't schedule coupled nodes on their own.
1518 if (scheduler_->GetPlacement(node) == Scheduler::kCoupled) {
1519 node = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
1520 }
1521
1522 // Test schedulability condition by looking at unscheduled use count.
1523 if (scheduler_->GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_ != 0) continue;
1524
1525 queue->push(node);
1526 do {
1527 scheduler_->tick_counter_->TickAndMaybeEnterSafepoint();
1528 Node* const n = queue->front();
1529 queue->pop();
1530 VisitNode(n);
1531 } while (!queue->empty());
1532 }
1533 }
1534
1535 // Visits one node from the queue of schedulable nodes and determines its
1536 // schedule late position. Also hoists nodes out of loops to find a more
1537 // optimal scheduling position.
1538 void VisitNode(Node* node) {
1539 DCHECK_EQ(0, scheduler_->GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_);
1540
1541 // Don't schedule nodes that are already scheduled.
1542 if (schedule_->IsScheduled(node)) return;
1543 DCHECK_EQ(Scheduler::kSchedulable, scheduler_->GetPlacement(node));
1544
1545 // Determine the dominating block for all of the uses of this node. It is
1546 // the latest block that this node can be scheduled in.
1547 TRACE("Scheduling #%d:%s\n", node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic());
1548 BasicBlock* block = GetCommonDominatorOfUses(node);
1549 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(block);
1550
1551 // The schedule early block dominates the schedule late block.
1552 BasicBlock* min_block = scheduler_->GetData(node)->minimum_block_;
1553 DCHECK_EQ(min_block, BasicBlock::GetCommonDominator(block, min_block));
1554
1555 TRACE(
1556 "Schedule late of #%d:%s is id:%d at loop depth %d, minimum = id:%d\n",
1557 node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic(), block->id().ToInt(),
1558 block->loop_depth(), min_block->id().ToInt());
1559
1560 // Hoist nodes out of loops if possible. Nodes can be hoisted iteratively
1561 // into enclosing loop pre-headers until they would precede their schedule
1562 // early position.
1563 BasicBlock* hoist_block = GetHoistBlock(block);
1564 if (hoist_block &&
1565 hoist_block->dominator_depth() >= min_block->dominator_depth()) {
1566 DCHECK(scheduler_->special_rpo_->HasLoopBlocks());
1567 do {
1568 TRACE(" hoisting #%d:%s to block id:%d\n", node->id(),
1569 node->op()->mnemonic(), hoist_block->id().ToInt());
1570 DCHECK_LT(hoist_block->loop_depth(), block->loop_depth());
1571 block = hoist_block;
1572 hoist_block = GetHoistBlock(hoist_block);
1573 } while (hoist_block &&
1574 hoist_block->dominator_depth() >= min_block->dominator_depth());
1575 } else if (scheduler_->flags_ & Scheduler::kSplitNodes) {
1576 // Split the {node} if beneficial and return the new {block} for it.
1577 block = SplitNode(block, node);
1578 }
1579
1580 // Schedule the node or a floating control structure.
1581 if (IrOpcode::IsMergeOpcode(node->opcode())) {
1582 ScheduleFloatingControl(block, node);
1583 } else if (node->opcode() == IrOpcode::kFinishRegion) {
1584 ScheduleRegion(block, node);
1585 } else {
1586 ScheduleNode(block, node);
1587 }
1588 }
1589
1590 bool IsMarked(BasicBlock* block) const {
1591 return marked_.Contains(block->id().ToInt());
1592 }
1593
1594 void Mark(BasicBlock* block) { marked_.Add(block->id().ToInt()); }
1595
1596 // Mark {block} and push its non-marked predecessor on the marking queue.
1597 void MarkBlock(BasicBlock* block) {
1598 Mark(block);
1599 for (BasicBlock* pred_block : block->predecessors()) {
1600 if (IsMarked(pred_block)) continue;
1601 marking_queue_.push_back(pred_block);
1602 }
1603 }
1604
1605 BasicBlock* SplitNode(BasicBlock* block, Node* node) {
1606 // For now, we limit splitting to pure nodes.
1607 if (!node->op()->HasProperty(Operator::kPure)) return block;
1608 // TODO(titzer): fix the special case of splitting of projections.
1609 if (node->opcode() == IrOpcode::kProjection) return block;
1610
1611 // The {block} is common dominator of all uses of {node}, so we cannot
1612 // split anything unless the {block} has at least two successors.
1613 DCHECK_EQ(block, GetCommonDominatorOfUses(node));
1614 if (block->SuccessorCount() < 2) return block;
1615
1616 // Clear marking bits.
1617 DCHECK(marking_queue_.empty());
1618 marked_.Clear();
1619 int new_size = static_cast<int>(schedule_->BasicBlockCount() + 1);
1620 if (marked_.length() < new_size) {
1621 marked_.Resize(new_size, scheduler_->zone_);
1622 }
1623
1624 // Check if the {node} has uses in {block}.
1625 for (Edge edge : node->use_edges()) {
1626 if (!scheduler_->IsLive(edge.from())) continue;
1627 BasicBlock* use_block = GetBlockForUse(edge);
1628 if (use_block == nullptr || IsMarked(use_block)) continue;
1629 if (use_block == block) {
1630 TRACE(" not splitting #%d:%s, it is used in id:%d\n", node->id(),
1631 node->op()->mnemonic(), block->id().ToInt());
1632 marking_queue_.clear();
1633 return block;
1634 }
1635 MarkBlock(use_block);
1636 }
1637
1638 // Compute transitive marking closure; a block is marked if all its
1639 // successors are marked.
1640 do {
1641 BasicBlock* top_block = marking_queue_.front();
1642 marking_queue_.pop_front();
1643 if (IsMarked(top_block)) continue;
1644 bool marked = true;
1645 if (top_block->loop_depth() == block->loop_depth()) {
1646 for (BasicBlock* successor : top_block->successors()) {
1647 if (!IsMarked(successor)) {
1648 marked = false;
1649 break;
1650 }
1651 }
1652 }
1653 if (marked) MarkBlock(top_block);
1654 } while (!marking_queue_.empty());
1655
1656 // If the (common dominator) {block} is marked, we know that all paths from
1657 // {block} to the end contain at least one use of {node}, and hence there's
1658 // no point in splitting the {node} in this case.
1659 if (IsMarked(block)) {
1660 TRACE(" not splitting #%d:%s, its common dominator id:%d is perfect\n",
1661 node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic(), block->id().ToInt());
1662 return block;
1663 }
1664
1665 // Split {node} for uses according to the previously computed marking
1666 // closure. Every marking partition has a unique dominator, which get's a
1667 // copy of the {node} with the exception of the first partition, which get's
1668 // the {node} itself.
1669 ZoneMap<BasicBlock*, Node*> dominators(scheduler_->zone_);
1670 for (Edge edge : node->use_edges()) {
1671 if (!scheduler_->IsLive(edge.from())) continue;
1672 BasicBlock* use_block = GetBlockForUse(edge);
1673 if (use_block == nullptr) continue;
1674 while (IsMarked(use_block->dominator())) {
1675 use_block = use_block->dominator();
1676 }
1677 auto& use_node = dominators[use_block];
1678 if (use_node == nullptr) {
1679 if (dominators.size() == 1u) {
1680 // Place the {node} at {use_block}.
1681 block = use_block;
1682 use_node = node;
1683 TRACE(" pushing #%d:%s down to id:%d\n", node->id(),
1684 node->op()->mnemonic(), block->id().ToInt());
1685 } else {
1686 // Place a copy of {node} at {use_block}.
1687 use_node = CloneNode(node);
1688 TRACE(" cloning #%d:%s for id:%d\n", use_node->id(),
1689 use_node->op()->mnemonic(), use_block->id().ToInt());
1690 scheduler_->schedule_queue_.push(use_node);
1691 }
1692 }
1693 edge.UpdateTo(use_node);
1694 }
1695 return block;
1696 }
1697
1698 BasicBlock* GetHoistBlock(BasicBlock* block) {
1699 if (!scheduler_->special_rpo_->HasLoopBlocks()) return nullptr;
1700 if (block->IsLoopHeader()) return block->dominator();
1701 // We have to check to make sure that the {block} dominates all
1702 // of the outgoing blocks. If it doesn't, then there is a path
1703 // out of the loop which does not execute this {block}, so we
1704 // can't hoist operations from this {block} out of the loop, as
1705 // that would introduce additional computations.
1706 if (BasicBlock* header_block = block->loop_header()) {
1707 for (BasicBlock* outgoing_block :
1708 scheduler_->special_rpo_->GetOutgoingBlocks(header_block)) {
1709 if (scheduler_->GetCommonDominator(block, outgoing_block) != block) {
1710 return nullptr;
1711 }
1712 }
1713 return header_block->dominator();
1714 }
1715 return nullptr;
1716 }
1717
1718 BasicBlock* GetCommonDominatorOfUses(Node* node) {
1719 BasicBlock* block = nullptr;
1720 for (Edge edge : node->use_edges()) {
1721 if (!scheduler_->IsLive(edge.from())) continue;
1722 BasicBlock* use_block = GetBlockForUse(edge);
1723 block = block == nullptr
1724 ? use_block
1725 : use_block == nullptr
1726 ? block
1727 : scheduler_->GetCommonDominator(block, use_block);
1728 }
1729 return block;
1730 }
1731
1732 BasicBlock* FindPredecessorBlock(Node* node) {
1733 return scheduler_->control_flow_builder_->FindPredecessorBlock(node);
1734 }
1735
1736 BasicBlock* GetBlockForUse(Edge edge) {
1737 // TODO(titzer): ignore uses from dead nodes (not visited in PrepareUses()).
1738 // Dead uses only occur if the graph is not trimmed before scheduling.
1739 Node* use = edge.from();
1740 if (IrOpcode::IsPhiOpcode(use->opcode())) {
1741 // If the use is from a coupled (i.e. floating) phi, compute the common
1742 // dominator of its uses. This will not recurse more than one level.
1743 if (scheduler_->GetPlacement(use) == Scheduler::kCoupled) {
1744 TRACE(" inspecting uses of coupled #%d:%s\n", use->id(),
1745 use->op()->mnemonic());
1746 // TODO(titzer): reenable once above TODO is addressed.
1747 // DCHECK_EQ(edge.to(), NodeProperties::GetControlInput(use));
1748 return GetCommonDominatorOfUses(use);
1749 }
1750 // If the use is from a fixed (i.e. non-floating) phi, we use the
1751 // predecessor block of the corresponding control input to the merge.
1752 if (scheduler_->GetPlacement(use) == Scheduler::kFixed) {
1753 TRACE(" input@%d into a fixed phi #%d:%s\n", edge.index(), use->id(),
1754 use->op()->mnemonic());
1755 Node* merge = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(use, 0);
1756 DCHECK(IrOpcode::IsMergeOpcode(merge->opcode()));
1757 Node* input = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(merge, edge.index());
1758 return FindPredecessorBlock(input);
1759 }
1760 } else if (IrOpcode::IsMergeOpcode(use->opcode())) {
1761 // If the use is from a fixed (i.e. non-floating) merge, we use the
1762 // predecessor block of the current input to the merge.
1763 if (scheduler_->GetPlacement(use) == Scheduler::kFixed) {
1764 TRACE(" input@%d into a fixed merge #%d:%s\n", edge.index(), use->id(),
1765 use->op()->mnemonic());
1766 return FindPredecessorBlock(edge.to());
1767 }
1768 }
1769 BasicBlock* result = schedule_->block(use);
1770 if (result == nullptr) return nullptr;
1771 TRACE(" must dominate use #%d:%s in id:%d\n", use->id(),
1772 use->op()->mnemonic(), result->id().ToInt());
1773 return result;
1774 }
1775
1776 void ScheduleFloatingControl(BasicBlock* block, Node* node) {
1777 scheduler_->FuseFloatingControl(block, node);
1778 }
1779
1780 void ScheduleRegion(BasicBlock* block, Node* region_end) {
1781 // We only allow regions of instructions connected into a linear
1782 // effect chain. The only value allowed to be produced by a node
1783 // in the chain must be the value consumed by the FinishRegion node.
1784
1785 // We schedule back to front; we first schedule FinishRegion.
1786 CHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kFinishRegion, region_end->opcode());
1787 ScheduleNode(block, region_end);
1788
1789 // Schedule the chain.
1790 Node* node = NodeProperties::GetEffectInput(region_end);
1791 while (node->opcode() != IrOpcode::kBeginRegion) {
1792 DCHECK_EQ(0, scheduler_->GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_);
1793 DCHECK_EQ(1, node->op()->EffectInputCount());
1794 DCHECK_EQ(1, node->op()->EffectOutputCount());
1795 DCHECK_EQ(0, node->op()->ControlOutputCount());
1796 // The value output (if there is any) must be consumed
1797 // by the EndRegion node.
1798 DCHECK(node->op()->ValueOutputCount() == 0 ||
1799 node == region_end->InputAt(0));
1800 ScheduleNode(block, node);
1801 node = NodeProperties::GetEffectInput(node);
1802 }
1803 // Schedule the BeginRegion node.
1804 DCHECK_EQ(0, scheduler_->GetData(node)->unscheduled_count_);
1805 ScheduleNode(block, node);
1806 }
1807
1808 void ScheduleNode(BasicBlock* block, Node* node) {
1809 schedule_->PlanNode(block, node);
1810 size_t block_id = block->id().ToSize();
1811 if (!scheduler_->scheduled_nodes_[block_id]) {
1812 scheduler_->scheduled_nodes_[block_id] = zone_->New<NodeVector>(zone_);
1813 }
1814 scheduler_->scheduled_nodes_[block_id]->push_back(node);
1815 scheduler_->UpdatePlacement(node, Scheduler::kScheduled);
1816 }
1817
1818 Node* CloneNode(Node* node) {
1819 int const input_count = node->InputCount();
1820 base::Optional<int> coupled_control_edge =
1821 scheduler_->GetCoupledControlEdge(node);
1822 for (int index = 0; index < input_count; ++index) {
1823 if (index != coupled_control_edge) {
1824 Node* const input = node->InputAt(index);
1825 scheduler_->IncrementUnscheduledUseCount(input, node);
1826 }
1827 }
1828 Node* const copy = scheduler_->graph_->CloneNode(node);
1829 TRACE(("clone #%d:%s -> #%d\n"), node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic(),
1830 copy->id());
1831 scheduler_->node_data_.resize(copy->id() + 1,
1832 scheduler_->DefaultSchedulerData());
1833 scheduler_->node_data_[copy->id()] = scheduler_->node_data_[node->id()];
1834 return copy;
1835 }
1836
1837 Zone* zone_;
1838 Scheduler* scheduler_;
1839 Schedule* schedule_;
1840 BitVector marked_;
1841 ZoneDeque<BasicBlock*> marking_queue_;
1842};
1843
1844
1845void Scheduler::ScheduleLate() {
1846 TRACE("--- SCHEDULE LATE ------------------------------------------\n");
1847 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) {
1848 TRACE("roots: ");
1849 for (Node* node : schedule_root_nodes_) {
1850 TRACE("#%d:%s ", node->id(), node->op()->mnemonic());
1851 }
1852 TRACE("\n");
1853 }
1854
1855 // Schedule: Places nodes in dominator block of all their uses.
1856 ScheduleLateNodeVisitor schedule_late_visitor(zone_, this);
1857 schedule_late_visitor.Run(&schedule_root_nodes_);
1858}
1859
1860
1861// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1862// Phase 6: Seal the final schedule.
1863
1864
1865void Scheduler::SealFinalSchedule() {
1866 TRACE("--- SEAL FINAL SCHEDULE ------------------------------------\n");
1867
1868 // Serialize the assembly order and reverse-post-order numbering.
1869 special_rpo_->SerializeRPOIntoSchedule();
1870 special_rpo_->PrintAndVerifySpecialRPO();
1871
1872 // Add collected nodes for basic blocks to their blocks in the right order.
1873 int block_num = 0;
1874 for (NodeVector* nodes : scheduled_nodes_) {
1875 BasicBlock::Id id = BasicBlock::Id::FromInt(block_num++);
1876 BasicBlock* block = schedule_->GetBlockById(id);
1877 if (nodes) {
1878 for (Node* node : base::Reversed(*nodes)) {
1879 schedule_->AddNode(block, node);
1880 }
1881 }
1882 }
1883#ifdef LOG_BUILTIN_BLOCK_COUNT
1884 if (const ProfileDataFromFile* profile_data = this->profile_data()) {
1885 for (BasicBlock* block : *schedule_->all_blocks()) {
1886 uint64_t executed_count =
1887 profile_data->GetExecutedCount(block->id().ToSize());
1888 block->set_pgo_execution_count(executed_count);
1889 }
1890 }
1891#endif
1892}
1893
1894
1895// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1896
1897
1898void Scheduler::FuseFloatingControl(BasicBlock* block, Node* node) {
1899 TRACE("--- FUSE FLOATING CONTROL ----------------------------------\n");
1900 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) {
1901 StdoutStream{} << "Schedule before control flow fusion:\n" << *schedule_;
1902 }
1903
1904 // Iterate on phase 1: Build control-flow graph.
1905 control_flow_builder_->Run(block, node);
1906
1907 // Iterate on phase 2: Compute special RPO and dominator tree.
1908 special_rpo_->UpdateSpecialRPO(block, schedule_->block(node));
1909 // TODO(turbofan): Currently "iterate on" means "re-run". Fix that.
1910 for (BasicBlock* b = block->rpo_next(); b != nullptr; b = b->rpo_next()) {
1911 b->set_dominator_depth(-1);
1912 b->set_dominator(nullptr);
1913 }
1914 PropagateImmediateDominators(block->rpo_next());
1915
1916 // Iterate on phase 4: Schedule nodes early.
1917 // TODO(turbofan): The following loop gathering the propagation roots is a
1918 // temporary solution and should be merged into the rest of the scheduler as
1919 // soon as the approach settled for all floating loops.
1920 NodeVector propagation_roots(control_flow_builder_->control_);
1921 for (Node* control : control_flow_builder_->control_) {
1922 for (Node* use : control->uses()) {
1923 if (NodeProperties::IsPhi(use) && IsLive(use)) {
1924 propagation_roots.push_back(use);
1925 }
1926 }
1927 }
1928 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) {
1929 TRACE("propagation roots: ");
1930 for (Node* r : propagation_roots) {
1931 TRACE("#%d:%s ", r->id(), r->op()->mnemonic());
1932 }
1933 TRACE("\n");
1934 }
1935 ScheduleEarlyNodeVisitor schedule_early_visitor(zone_, this);
1936 schedule_early_visitor.Run(&propagation_roots);
1937
1938 // Move previously planned nodes.
1939 // TODO(turbofan): Improve that by supporting bulk moves.
1940 scheduled_nodes_.resize(schedule_->BasicBlockCount());
1941 MovePlannedNodes(block, schedule_->block(node));
1942
1943 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo_scheduler) {
1944 StdoutStream{} << "Schedule after control flow fusion:\n" << *schedule_;
1945 }
1946}
1947
1948
1949void Scheduler::MovePlannedNodes(BasicBlock* from, BasicBlock* to) {
1950 TRACE("Move planned nodes from id:%d to id:%d\n", from->id().ToInt(),
1951 to->id().ToInt());
1952 NodeVector* from_nodes = scheduled_nodes_[from->id().ToSize()];
1953 NodeVector* to_nodes = scheduled_nodes_[to->id().ToSize()];
1954 if (!from_nodes) return;
1955
1956 for (Node* const node : *from_nodes) {
1957 schedule_->SetBlockForNode(to, node);
1958 }
1959 if (to_nodes) {
1960 to_nodes->insert(to_nodes->end(), from_nodes->begin(), from_nodes->end());
1961 from_nodes->clear();
1962 } else {
1963 std::swap(scheduled_nodes_[from->id().ToSize()],
1964 scheduled_nodes_[to->id().ToSize()]);
1965 }
1966}
1967
1968#undef TRACE
1969
1970} // namespace compiler
1971} // namespace internal
1972} // namespace v8
